business logic to the Controller contractSecurity Features:      - Cryptographic proof verification via Risc0      - User-specific data access controls      - Delegation to trusted Controller contractArchitecture:      - SimpleTeleportVerifier: Proof verification and access control      - Controller: Business logic and data processing      - This separation allows for upgradeability and acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

claim(((bytes4,bytes32[8],uint8),bytes32.details: This is the main claim function that accepts any selector and encoded dataSecurity:      - Requires cryptographic proof verification via onlyVerified modifier      - Only the claimer can update their own data via onlyClaimer modifier      - All data processing is delegated to the trusted Controller contract

params.claimer: The address of the user claiming their data
params.encodedData: The encoded data returned from the prover
params.proof: The cryptographic proof that validates the data authenticity
params.selector: The function selector identifying which prover function was used

constructor.details: Sets up the trusted prover and controller

params._controller: Address of the Controller contract for data processing
params._prover: Address of the trusted prover contract for data verification
params.initialOwner: Address of the initial owner who can update the contracts

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setController(address).details: Only the contract owner can call this function

params.newController: The address of the new controller contract

setProver(address).details: Only the contract owner can call this function

params.newProver: The address of the new prover contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

claim(((bytes4,bytes32[8],uint8),bytes32.notice: Public claim function with new interface

controller().notice: Address of the Controller contract that handles data processing

prover().notice: Address of the trusted prover contract for data verification
